segments.text: are you ready for the meeting ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes , come on in . how's your new job going ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it's challenging , but I'm enjoying it quite a bit .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's great . I knew you'd do a good job as a manager .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: how's your assistant manager getting on ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: well , that's part of the problem . His probation period is up tomorrow and I don't think he's ready to pass .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: what seems to be the problem ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: well , he was supposed to be able to learn his job in 30 days , but he just doesn't seem to know what he's doing .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: if you gave him another 30 days , do you think he could figure it out by then ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: to be honest , he has no authority . He's a hard-worker , but no one listens to him .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I see . Not everyone is cut out to work in management .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know . It'd be great if we could transfer him to a department where he doesn't have to work with people .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: there's an opening in the creative design department . It involves working with computers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's perfect . I'll let him know tomorrow . Thanks !
segments.speaker: S1
